main: ^It is a religious and cultural festival in Iloilo City, Philippines, held annually on the 4th Sunday of anuary, or right after the Sinulog in Cebu and the Ati-Atihan Festival in Kalibo, Aklan. Dinagyang is one of the biggest and world-class festivals in the Philippines, attracting more than a million domestic and international visitors every year.

c-0: ^It is the Ilo-ilo’s version of Ati-atihan festival. The word Dinagyang came from a Hiligaynon word extrapolated from dágyang, meaning “merrymaking.”
